## GAD-7 vs DERS

GAD-7 vs DERS Understanding and comparing different psychological assessment tools is crucial for researchers and clinicians. Particularly, when you consider widely used instruments like the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and the Difficulties in Emotion Regulation Scale (DERS). The GAD-7 vs DERS comparison is a common challenge, with key dissimilarities and overlaps that need detailed attention. Harmony is a game-changing software that can significantly simplify the process of comparing such different questionnaires. Harmony leverages the power of natural language processing and AI to compare and harmonise questionnaire items including those from GAD-7 vs DERS. It flexibly facilitates the process, even allowing you to drag and drop your own instruments in different formats, such as PDF, into the system. Have some of these questionnaires in different languages? No worries! Harmony has capabilities to compare items in multiple languages. The proficiency with which Harmony can execute a GAD-7 vs DERS comparison makes it a must-have tool for researchers and psychologists. You select the instruments, Harmony does the heavy lifting, saving you precious time and effort. Backed by large language models, it does the tedious jobs quickly, allowing you to focus on the analysis at hand. We encourage you to try it at [Harmony Web Interface](https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app) and see how it takes care of the complexity of comparing GAD-7 vs DERS or any other assessment tools.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and DERS

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and DERS into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just DERS into Harmony</a> - compare DERS with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
